p: Future daily temperature data projected using 27 GCMs under three RCP scenarios were collected from Coupled Model Inter-comparison Project 5 (CMIP5) ( Table S1) [ 1, 21]. A single ensemble was used for each GCM model. We chose RCP2.6, RCP4.5, and RCP8.5 scenarios to represent the low, middle, and high greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, respectively. Because GCMs often provide biased simulated temperature which are usually at coarse spatial resolution [ 22], we employed three bias-correction models ( unbiasing, qqmap, and isi-mip) to downscale the projected temperature data to a finer spatial resolution of 0.5 °C × 0.5 °C [ 23], in which the daily TM data of 680 meteorological stations during 1960–1999 in China [ 24] was used as a training dataset. We finally selected the results derived from isi-mip as input for projection as it outperformed the other two methods ( Figure S2). The output corresponding to the geographical location of Guangzhou was used.
